results.definition: a reason for wanting something done
a diversion that occupies one's time and thoughts (usually pleasantly)
examples: he counts reading among his interests

results.definition: the power of attracting or holding one's attention (because it is unusual or exciting etc.)
examples: they said nothing of great interest
primary colors can add interest to a room

results.definition: a sense of concern with and curiosity about someone or something
(law) a right or legal share of something; a financial involvement with something
examples: they have interests all over the world

results.definition: (usually plural) a social group whose members control some field of activity and who have common aims
examples: the iron interests stepped up production

results.definition: a fixed charge for borrowing money; usually a percentage of the amount borrowed
examples: how much interest do you pay on your mortgage?

results.definition: excite the curiosity of; engage the interest of
